questions.question: Ethereum transitioned from _______ to Proof of Stake during the Merge.
The smallest unit of ETH is called _______.
Ethereum's virtual machine, known as _______, processes smart contracts.
Gas fees are paid in the cryptocurrency _______.
Validators are required to stake at least _______ ETH to participate in Ethereum’s Proof of Stake.
The cypherpunk movement aims to achieve _______ through cryptography.
Zero-knowledge proof systems like _______ are used to enhance transaction privacy in Ethereum.
A protocol enabling private Ethereum transactions is called _______.
The use of _______ prevents replay attacks on Ethereum transactions.
Cypherpunks advocate for the use of _______ to resist censorship and surveillance.
Ethereum’s human-readable address system is called _______.
_______ wallets allow users to recover their accounts without remembering their seed phrase.
A user-friendly interface for interacting with Ethereum dApps is provided by the _______ wallet.
High _______ fees are a common usability challenge in Ethereum.
An Ethereum wallet stores private keys and allows users to sign _______.
The _______ mechanism burns a portion of transaction fees to make ETH potentially deflationary.
In Proof of Stake, validators risk losing funds through _______ for dishonest behavior.
Ethereum uses _______ fees to prevent spam transactions on the network.
_______ is the total reward earned by validators for adding a block to the Ethereum blockchain.
MEV stands for _______ Extractable Value.
Ethereum transitioned from _______ to Proof of Stake during the Merge.
